PerformanceResourceTiming.summary: The PerformanceResourceTiming interface enables retrieval and analysis of detailed network timing data regarding the loading of an application's resources. An application can use the timing metrics to determine, for example, the length of time it takes to fetch a specific resource, such as an , {{SVGElement("SVG","SVG element")}}, image, or script.

remarks.para: -Resource timing (Overview)

PerformanceResourceTimingRenderBlockingS.summary: The renderBlockingStatus read-only property returns the render-blocking status of the resource.

remarks.para: It is useful to determine resources that:

PerformanceResourceTimingRenderBlockingS.value: The renderBlockingStatus property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingContentType.summary: NOTE Experimental The contentType read-only property of the interface is a string indicating the content type of the fetched resource, formatted as a {{glossary("MIME type")}} and subtype separated by a forward slash.

remarks.para:
The content type is a minimized and "standardized" version of the MIME type that is extracted from the Content-Type HTTP header sent in the resource's fetch response.
For JavaScript, JSON, SVG, and XML, the MIME type is replaced by a representative MIME type/subtype string.
Other types supported by the browser are represented by the MIME type/subtype string in the header (other information in the header is discarded).

PerformanceResourceTimingContentType.value:
A string indicating the MIME type "essence" of the content.
This may be one of the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingDeliveryType.summary: NOTE Experimental The deliveryType read-only property is a string indicating how the resource was delivered â€” for example from the cache or from a navigational prefetch.
PerformanceResourceTimingDeliveryType.value: A string, which can be one of the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingRequestStart.summary: The requestStart read-only property returns a of the time immediately before the browser starts requesting the resource from the server, cache, or local resource. If the transport connection fails and the browser retires the request, the value returned will be the start of the retry request.

remarks.para: There is no end property for requestStart. To measure the request time, calculate - requestStart (see the example below).
-Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingRequestStart.value: The requestStart property can have the following values:When the is non-zero, that indicates it should be the same value as requestStart for supporting browsers.When there are no interim responses, requestStart is the same as finalResponseHeadersStart and firstInterimResponseStart is 0.

PerformanceResourceTimingResponseEnd.summary: The responseEnd read-only property returns a immediately after the browser receives the last byte of the resource or immediately before the transport connection is closed, whichever comes first.

remarks.para: Unlike many other PerformanceResourceTiming properties, the responseEnd property is available for cross-origin requests without the need of the Timing-Allow-Origin HTTP response header.

PerformanceResourceTimingResponseEnd.value:
A immediately after the browser receives the last
byte of the resource or immediately before the transport connection is closed, whichever
comes first.

PerformanceResourceTimingFirstInterimRes.summary: NOTE Experimental The firstInterimResponseStart read-only property returns a immediately after the browser receives the first byte of the interim 1xx response (for example, 100 Continue or 103 Early Hints) from the server.

remarks.para: There is no end property for firstInterimResponseStart.

-Timing-Allow-Origin
-

PerformanceResourceTimingFirstInterimRes.value:
The firstInterimResponseStart property can have the following values:
NOTEAs Early Hints are typically only supported on the main navigation request, which is by definition same-origin, a 0 typically indicates Early Hints were not used.When the firstInterimResponseStart is non-zero, that indicates it should be the same value as for supporting browsers.

PerformanceResourceTimingResponseStatus.summary: The responseStatus read-only property represents the HTTP response status code returned when fetching the resource.

remarks.para: This property maps to from the Fetch API.

-HTTP response status code
-
-CORS

PerformanceResourceTimingResponseStatus.value: The responseStatus property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingDomainLookupSta.summary: The domainLookupStart read-only property returns the immediately before the browser starts the domain name lookup for the resource.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingDomainLookupSta.value: The domainLookupStart property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingSecureConnectio.summary: The secureConnectionStart read-only property returns a immediately before the browser starts the handshake process to secure the current connection. If a secure connection is not used, the property returns zero.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingSecureConnectio.value: The secureConnectionStart property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingConnectEnd.summary: The connectEnd read-only property returns the immediately after the browser finishes establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the resource. The timestamp value includes the time interval to establish the transport connection, as well as other time intervals such as TLS handshake and SOCKS authentication.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingConnectEnd.value: The connectEnd property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingDomainLookupEnd.summary: The domainLookupEnd read-only property returns the immediately after the browser finishes the domain-name lookup for the resource.

remarks.para: If the user agent has the domain information in cache, and domainLookupEnd represent the times when the user agent starts and ends the domain data retrieval from the cache.
-Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingDomainLookupEnd.value: The domainLookupEnd property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingInitiatorType.summary: The initiatorType read-only property is a string representing web platform feature that initiated the resource load.

blockquote.para: This property does not represent the type of content fetched. A .css file can be fetched using a link element leading to an initiatorType of link. When loading images using background: url() in a CSS file, the initiatorType will be css and not img.

PerformanceResourceTimingInitiatorType.value: The initiatorType property can have the following values, or other if none of the conditions match.

PerformanceResourceTimingServerTiming.summary: The serverTiming read-only property returns an array of entries containing server timing metrics.

remarks.para: Server timing metrics require the server to send the Server-Timing header. For example:
The serverTiming entries can live on navigation and resource entries.

-
-Server-Timing

PerformanceResourceTimingResponseStart.summary: The responseStart read-only property returns a immediately after the browser receives the first byte of the response from the server, cache, or local resource.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingResponseStart.value: The responseStart property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingFetchStart.summary: The fetchStart read-only property represents a immediately before the browser starts to fetch the resource.

remarks.para: If there are HTTP redirects, the property returns the time immediately before the user agent starts to fetch the final resource in the redirection.
Unlike many other PerformanceResourceTiming properties, the fetchStart property is available for cross-origin requests without the need of the Timing-Allow-Origin HTTP response header.

PerformanceResourceTimingFetchStart.value:
A immediately before the browser starts to fetch the
resource.

PerformanceResourceTimingEncodedBodySize.summary:
The encodedBodySize read-only property represents the size (in octets) received from the fetch (HTTP or cache) of the payload body before removing any applied content encodings (like gzip or Brotli). If the resource is retrieved from an application cache or a local resource, it must
return the size of the payload body before removing any applied content encoding.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingEncodedBodySize.value: The encodedBodySize property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingDecodedBodySize.summary: The decodedBodySize read-only property returns the size (in octets) received from the fetch (HTTP or cache) of the message body after removing any applied content encoding (like gzip or Brotli). If the resource is retrieved from an application cache or local resources, it returns the size of the payload after removing any applied content encoding.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingDecodedBodySize.value: The decodedBodySize property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingNextHopProtocol.summary: The nextHopProtocol read-only property is a string representing the network protocol used to fetch the resource, as identified by the ALPN Protocol ID (RFC7301).

remarks.para: When a proxy is used, if a tunnel connection is established, this property returns the ALPN Protocol ID of the tunneled protocol. Otherwise, this property returns the ALPN Protocol ID of the first hop to the proxy.

-Timing-Allow-Origin
-HTTP 2
-HTTP 3

PerformanceResourceTimingNextHopProtocol.value: The nextHopProtocol property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingTransferSize.summary: The transferSize read-only property represents the size (in octets) of the fetched resource. The size includes the response header fields plus the response payload body (as defined by RFC7230).

remarks.para: If the resource is fetched from a local cache, or if it is a cross-origin resource, this property returns zero.
-Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingTransferSize.value: The transferSize property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingRedirectEnd.summary: The redirectEnd read-only property returns a immediately after receiving the last byte of the response of the last redirect.

remarks.para: When fetching a resource, if there are multiple HTTP redirects, and any of the redirects have an origin that is different from the current document, and the timing allow check algorithm passes for each redirected resource, this property returns the time immediately after receiving the last byte of the response of the last redirect; otherwise, zero is returned.
To get the amount of redirects, see also .

-
-Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingRedirectEnd.value: The redirectEnd property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingWorkerStart.summary:
The workerStart read-only property of the interface returns a
immediately before dispatching the if a Service Worker thread is already running, or immediately before starting the Service Worker thread if it is not already running. If the resource is not intercepted by a Service Worker the property will always return 0.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingWorkerStart.value: The workerStart property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingFinalResponseHe.summary: NOTE Experimental The finalResponseHeadersStart read-only property returns a immediately after the browser receives the first byte of the final document response (for example, 200 OK) from the server.

remarks.para: This differs from (which may also be represented as ), as this starts from the first bytes of any response including interim responses (for example, 103 Early Hints) with the final response coming potentially much later.
When there are no interim responses, requestStart is the same as finalResponseHeadersStart and firstInterimResponseStart is 0.
There is no end property for finalResponseHeadersStart.

-Timing-Allow-Origin
-

PerformanceResourceTimingFinalResponseHe.value: The finalResponseHeadersStart property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingConnectStart.summary: The connectStart read-only property returns the immediately before the user agent starts establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the resource.

remarks.para: -Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingConnectStart.value: The connectStart property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingRedirectStart.summary: The redirectStart read-only property returns a representing the start time of the fetch which that initiates the redirect.

remarks.para: If there are HTTP redirects when fetching the resource and if any of the redirects are not from the same origin as the current document, but the timing allow check algorithm passes for each redirected resource, this property returns the starting time of the fetch that initiates the redirect; otherwise, zero is returned.
To get the amount of redirects, see also .

-
-Timing-Allow-Origin

PerformanceResourceTimingRedirectStart.value: The redirectStart property can have the following values:

PerformanceResourceTimingToJSON.summary: The toJSON() method of the interface is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the object.
PerformanceResourceTimingToJSON.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
